structural: C1. Σ must be applied after all δ, Φ, Π normalization steps.
C2. Σ must respect Θ polarity routing: Θ(X,Y) is resolved before Σ.
C3. Σ must commute with μ, λ, ψ up to weighted, curvature, and modal contraction terms.
C4. Σ is idempotent: Σ(Σ(X)) \= Σ(X).
C5. No operator may follow Σ; Σ is terminal in all expressions.
C6. Σ must reduce tensor ranks via Σ⊗ when present.
C7. Σ must produce a single semantic state; reduction must be total.
C8. Σ must not expand any operator; contraction is monotonic.
normal\_form: NF1. NF(B) is a scalar semantic state produced by Σ.
NF2. All δ, Φ, Π components are contracted in NF(B).
NF3. μ, λ, ψ weighting, curvature, and modal contributions appear only in their contracted residues.
NF4. Polarity effects survive only as sign/phase in the contracted NF(B).
